channel.title: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)
channel.description: Disgusting slow bass, minimal percussions, droning stretched out leads, and too long for its own good. https://soundcloud.com/devoidofjoy/negative-space

item.title: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)
item.dc:creator: Devoid-of-joy
item.description:
I’ve made a minimal attempt once before and just couldn’t get it to work.
It’s easier to send it to GarageBand and sample into it there lol. I’d like to run some automations on some already heavily filtered ms20 samples at some point.

Read full topic
item.source: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)

item.title: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I kind of figured, one of these days, would LOVE to hear the integration of your gear.

I get it though. Having everything just in the box at your fingertips is so much easier than setting up gear, recording, cleaning it up, importing etc etc. On iOS it’s not exactly the sexiest of workflows lol…

Read full topic
item.source: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)

item.title: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)
item.dc:creator: Devoid-of-joy
item.description:
If I’m understanding your question, I have yet to import any samples into Auxy. I would like to import some samples from my analog setup but I haven’t found the time. Everything in recent is just stuff in Auxy. All if which is heavily automated but nothing that anyone else with a subscription couldn’t manage if they wanted to.

Read full topic
item.source: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)

item.title: Negative Space - Devoid of Joy (sludgy industrial)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Oh hello Doom soundtrack by Mick Gordon!

All kidding aside, I dig it. As usual, fantastic soundscape - still love hearing this kind of sound coaxed out of the app.

Do you ever use samples in your workflow? Like, not percussive so much, but more along the lines of something melodic with pitch automation? Just curious.

Read full topic
